column3: expects U.S. antitrust clearance NEW YORK/TEL AVIV
column4: July 13 Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd said on Wednesday it expected its $40 billion deal to buy Allergan Plc's generics business to close "at any time
column5:
even as the companies extended the deadline for completing the transaction to October to allow more time for the U.S. antitrust review. ~CORRECTED-Allergan extends Teva deal deadline July 13 Allergan Plc said it extended the deadline to close a deal to sell its generic business to Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd by three months to October. ~BRIEF-Allergan, Teva deal approval expected in next 2 weeks - CNBC * Allergan, Teva deal approval expected in next 2 weeks - CNBC citing sources   Further company coverage: [AGN.N TEVA.TA]   (Bengaluru Newsroom: +1 646 223 8780) ~BRIEF-Israel's Teva Pharm provides 2016-2019 financial estimates * Sees 2016 revenue $22.0-$22.5 bln, non-gaap EPS $5.20-$5.40 ~BRIEF-Allergan, Teva entered amendment to master purchase agreement * Co and teva pharmaceutical industries ltd entered into an amendment, dated july 11, 2016 to master purchase agreement ~
AMGN.O,UPDATE 2-U.S. FDA panel supports Novartis version of Amgen arthritis drug July 13 Novartis AG's cheaper version of Amgen Inc's arthritis drug Enbrel is highly similar in potency and safety to the original and should be approved, an advisory panel to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration concluded on Wednesday. ~
AAPL.O,LG Display sees signs of display market improvement PAJU, South Korea, July 13 South Korea's LG Display Co Ltd is seeing signs of improvement in the display panel industry and expects its business performance to pick up in the second half of the year, the firm's chief executive said. ~
BLK,U.S. fund investors tiptoe back into junk bonds, global stocks By Trevor Hunnicutt     NEW YORK, July 13 U.S. mutual-fund investors bought international stocks and riskier bonds during the latest week, reversing course after pulling the most cash this year from funds following the Brexit vote, Investment Company Institute data showed on Wednesday.      ICI said investors added $2 billion to U.S.-based funds invested in developed-market stocks outside the country during the week ended July 6, after pulling $2.7 billion from the funds the week bef ~
BA,Boeing KC-46A tanker uses modified boom to pass fuel to C-17: U.S. Air Force FARNBOROUGH, England Boeing Co's KC-46A refueling plane has successfully transferred fuel to an F-16 fighter jet and a C-17 cargo plane using a modified boom outfitted with new hydraulic pressure relief valves, the U.S. Air Force said on Wednesday. ~AIRSHOW-Boeing KC-46A tanker uses modified boom to pass fuel to C-17 - U.S. Air Force FARNBOROUGH, England, July 13 Boeing Co's  KC-46A refueling plane has successfully transferred fuel to an F-16 fighter jet and a C-17 cargo plane using a modified boom outfitted with new hydraulic pressure relief valves, the U.S. Air Force said on Wednesday. ~Factbox: Airbus, Boeing commercial aircraft deals at Farnborough Airshow FARNBOROUGH, England Following is a summary of the commercial aircraft deals announced by Airbus  and Boeing  at the Farnborough Airshow in southern England. ~BRIEF-Boeing, Air Europa announce order for 20 737 MAX 8s * Air europa now has a combined total of 22 787-8s and 787-9s on order as it continues its transition to an all-boeing long-haul fleet  Source text for Eikon:  Further company coverage:    (Bengaluru Newsroom: +1-646-223-8780) ~Factbox: Airbus, Boeing commercial aircraft deals at Farnborough Airshow FARNBOROUGH, England Following is a summary of the commercial aircraft deals announced by Airbus  and Boeing  at the Farnborough Airshow in southern England. ~BRIEF-Boeing, Ruili Airlines finalize order for six 787-9 dreamliners * Boeing, Ruili Airlines Finalize Order For Six 787 9 dreamliners ~New Boeing defense CEO focuses on basics, growth areas FARNBOROUGH, England Boeing Co's defense chief, Leanne Caret, said the No. 2 U.S. arms maker must focus on improving program performance and listening better to customers after setbacks on the $49 billion KC-46A tanker and its loss of a big U.S. bomber deal. ~BRIEF-Boeing announces 10 new orders and commitments for Boeing converted freighters * Boeing announces 10 new orders and commitments for boeing converted freighters ~BRIEF-HUNEED TECHNOLOGIES signs 16.8 bln won contract with Boeing * Says it signs a contract with The Boeing Company, to supply airplane electronic equipment ~

C,Citibank to close certain Venezuela accounts Citigroup Inc  said its unit will stop correspondent banking and servicing of certain accounts in Venezuela. ~
COP,CORRECTED-Woodside to buy ConocoPhillips' Senegal holdings for $350 mln MELBOURNE, July 14 Australia's Woodside Petroleum has agreed to buy ConocoPhillips'  deepwater stakes off Senegal, including one of the world's most promising recent oil finds, for $350 million. ~BRIEF-ConocoPhillips sets quarterly dividend of $0.25/shr * Sets quarterly dividend of $0.25 per share  Source text for Eikon:  Further company coverage: ~
CSX.O,UPDATE 2-Lower costs help CSX beat profit estimates; coal volumes down CHICAGO, July 13 CSX Corp, the third-largest U.S. railroad, on Wednesday posted a lower second-quarter net profit that beat expectations as lower costs partly offset a 34 percent drop in coal volumes. ~CSX quarterly profit falls CHICAGO, July 13 CSX Corp, the third-largest U.S. railroad, on Wednesday reported a lower second-quarter net profit, driven by an overall decline in freight volumes of 9 percent. ~BRIEF-CSX Corp posts Q2 revenue of $2.7 bln vs $3.06 bln * Q2 revenue view $2.69 billion -- Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S  Source text (http://bit.ly/29I2oZC) Further company coverage: ~BRIEF-CSX Corporation Q2 earnings per share $0.47 * Q2 earnings per share view $0.44 -- Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S ~US STOCKS-Wall St set to open flat after record-setting rally * Futures up: Dow 8 pts, S&P; 1.75 pts, Nasdaq 7 pts   (Adds details, comments, updates prices) ~US STOCKS-Futures flat a day after S&P; 500, Dow hit record highs July 13 U.S. stock index futures were flat on Wednesday as investors stopped to take a breather a day after the S&P; 500 and the Dow hit record highs, amid growing optimism about the economy. ~
XOM,U.S. House panel subpoenas New York, Massachusetts attorneys general WASHINGTON A U.S. House of Representatives panel on Wednesday issued subpoenas to the attorneys general of New York and Massachusetts to force them to submit information on their investigations into whether Exxon Mobil misled investors on climate change risks, accusing the attorneys general of having a political agenda. ~U.S. House panel subpoenas New York, Massachusetts attorneys general WASHINGTON, July 13 A U.S. House of Representatives panel on Wednesday issued subpoenas to the attorneys general of New York and Massachusetts to force them to submit information on their investigations into whether Exxon Mobil misled investors on climate change risks, accusing the attorneys general of having a political agenda. ~
GM,GM not protected from ignition switch claims - U.S. appeals court NEW YORK General Motors' 2009 bankruptcy does not shield it from lawsuits over a deadly ignition-switch defect that led to criminal charges against the automaker and prompted the recall of 2.6 million vehicles in 2014, a federal appeals court ruled on Wednesday. ~UPDATE 3-GM not shielded from ignition-switch suits - U.S. appeals court NEW YORK, July 13 General Motors' 2009 bankruptcy does not shield it from lawsuits over a deadly ignition-switch defect that led to criminal charges against the automaker and prompted the recall of 2.6 million vehicles in 2014, a federal appeals court ruled on Wednesday. ~CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-GM not protected from ignition switch claims - U.S. appeals court NEW YORK, July 13 In a blow to General Motors Co , a federal appeals court on Wednesday reversed part of a bankruptcy court ruling that protected the automaker from some lawsuits over an ignition switch defect that prompted the recall of 2.6 million vehicles in 2014. ~
GS,Ex-Goldman programmer cannot recoup fees from bank -judge July 13 A former Goldman Sachs Group Inc  programmer who has spent seven years and incurred more than $8 million in bills fighting charges he stole computer code failed to persuade a Delaware judge to force the bank to advance some of his legal fees. ~France urges ex-chief of EU Commission to drop plan for Goldman job PARIS The French government called on former European Commission chief Jose Manuel Barroso on Wednesday to drop plans to take a senior job at U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs, part of a growing outcry against the move. ~UPDATE 1-France urges ex-chief of EU Commission to drop plan for Goldman job PARIS, July 13 The French government called on former European Commission chief Jose Manuel Barroso on Wednesday to drop plans to take a senior job at U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs, part of a growing outcry against the move. ~France urges ex EU commission chief to drop plan for Goldman job PARIS, July 13 The French government called on former European Commission chief Jose Manuel Barroso to drop plans to take a senior job at U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs, describing the move as scandalous". ~EU mergers and takeovers (July 13) BRUSSELS
